greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Minimal prime with n prime substrings (substrings with leading zeros are considered to be nonprime).
link: Hieronymus Fischer, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..40
example: a(1)=2, since 2 is a prime has 1 prime substring (2).
a(2)=13, since 13 is prime and has 2 prime substrings (3 and 13)
results.author: _Hieronymus Fischer_, Aug 26 2012
